column4: sorry to say but Ubuntu is proving to be a further let-down with each new release ... :(
Kernel Panics since Intrepid ... and no help in sight ...
maybe you are expecting it to be too much like windows?
they also fixed a lot of things im sure, just different bugs heh
oh certainly ... but what is the point of fixing something and breaking other things?
such is software development
and I am talking about wireless and graphic cards ... stuff that was working before ... and now is useless ...
that is not all ubuntu, if you are using proprietary graphics drivers for instance
that's not true ... and if it is then someone needs to find a new hobby
not using proprietary drivers
maybe that would fix your problem then.
have you checked System->Administration->Hardware Drivers?
uh ... why would I do that?
im using an atheros card on a macbook pro that is working fine
which wasnt true 3 releases ago incidently
what chipset and what driver?
way way better than what you used to have to do with madwifi or ndiswrapper
see that's the kicker ... there are many who have the same hardware who are not having issues and then others who are ... so maybe its a combination of hardware that makes the issue ...
